publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4397 Maureen Macmillan: Christian Aid Week, 14 to 20 May 2006—That the Parliament commends the work undertaken by Christian Aid which works in partnership with local organisations in more than 50 countries worldwide, helping people and tackling the causes of poverty and injustice; notes that Christian Aid Week takes place from 14 to 20 May 2006 when fundraising events will be taking place across the United Kingdom and Ireland to raise awareness and help those in the world’s poorest countries; further notes this year’s "You add. We multiply" campaign where, working with the world’s poorest communities, Christian Aid invests in things that multiply and provide benefits for years to come, helping people to improve their own lives whatever their race or religion; notes the report produced by Christian Aid which predicts that climate change could directly cause the deaths of 182 million sub-Saharan Africans by the end of the century, and therefore calls for the United Kingdom to cut its carbon emissions and urges people to give generously to Christian Aid week by logging on to www.caweek.org.

S2M-4397 Christian Aid Week, 14 to 20 May 2006 (lodged on 15 May 2006) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Fiona Hyslop*, Pauline McNeill*, Fergus Ewing*, Mike Pringle*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Sarah Boyack*, Christine May*, Helen Eadie*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mike Rumbles*, Christine Grahame*, Cathie Craigie*, Margaret Jamieson*, Michael McMahon*, Marlyn Glen*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Dave Petrie*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-4397 Christian Aid Week, 14 to 20 May 2006 (lodged on 15 May 2006) Alex Neil*, Eleanor Scott*, Bill Butler*, Karen Gillon*, Scott Barrie*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Trish Godman*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Kate Maclean*
S2M-4397 Christian Aid Week, 14 to 20 May 2006 (lodged on 15 May 2006) Marilyn Livingstone*, Rosie Kane*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Donald Gorrie*, Karen Whitefield*

S2M-4397 Maureen Macmillan: Christian Aid Week, 14 to 20 May 2006—That the Parliament commends the work undertaken by Christian Aid which works in partnership with local organisations in more than 50 countries worldwide, helping people and tackling the causes of poverty and injustice; notes that Christian Aid Week takes place from 14 to 20 May 2006 when fundraising events will be taking place across the United Kingdom and Ireland to raise awareness and help those in the world’s poorest countries; further notes this year’s "You add. We multiply" campaign where, working with the world’s poorest communities, Christian Aid invests in things that multiply and provide benefits for years to come, helping people to improve their own lives whatever their race or religion; notes the report produced by Christian Aid which predicts that climate change could directly cause the deaths of 182 million sub-Saharan Africans by the end of the century, and therefore calls for the United Kingdom to cut its carbon emissions and urges people to give generously to Christian Aid week by logging on to www.caweek.org. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Fiona Hyslop, Pauline McNeill, Fergus Ewing, Mike Pringle, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Sarah Boyack, Christine May, Helen Eadie, Mr Jamie Stone, Mike Rumbles, Christine Grahame, Cathie Craigie, Margaret Jamieson, Michael McMahon, Marlyn Glen, Jackie Baillie, Mr Frank McAveety, Dave Petrie, Dr Elaine Murray, Ms Maureen Watt, Ms Sandra White, Alex Neil, Eleanor Scott, Bill Butler, Karen Gillon, Scott Barrie, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Trish Godman, Mr Jim Wallace, Kate Maclean, Marilyn Livingstone, Rosie Kane, Mr Adam Ingram, Donald Gorrie, Karen Whitefield, Dennis Canavan*, Mr David Davidson*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-4397 Christian Aid Week, 14 to 20 May 2006 (lodged on 15 May 2006) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-4397 Christian Aid Week, 14 to 20 May 2006 (lodged on 15 May 2006) Susan Deacon*
S2M-4397 Christian Aid Week, 14 to 20 May 2006 (lodged on 15 May 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
